title: Causal Reasoning in Complex Systems: Connecting Making and Analogical Reasoning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific theories and statistical concepts, including fundamental principles of causal analysis
context.additional_context: Advanced adult learners with prior experience in complex systems (e.g., ecology, social systems, machine learning) but struggling with interpreting non-deterministic causal relationships, in a real-time collaborative environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can identify probabilistic causal relationships in complex systems and represent them as network diagrams
Learners can connect causal mechanisms across different domains (e.g., biology ↔ game systems) through analogical reasoning
Learners can generate causal hypotheses based on statistical patterns under limited data conditions (e.g., time delays, spatial dispersion)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
